title: Quadratic Equation Study
content:
Solving Quadratic Equations

A quadratic equation is of the form:

ax^2 + bx + c = 0

The solutions are given by the quadratic formula:

x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}

\int_{a}^b f(x) d x = F(b) - F(a)

title: Pythagorean Theorem
content:
The Pythagorean Theorem

In a right-angled triangle, the square of the hypotenuse is equal to the sum of the squares of the other two sides:

a^2 + b^2 = c^2

For example, if a=3 and b=4, then c = \sqrt{3^2 + 4^2} = \sqrt{9 + 16} = \sqrt{25} = 5.

\int_{a}^b f(x) d x = F(b) - F(a)

title: Calculus Basics
content:
Basic Derivatives

The derivative of a power function is given by:

\frac{d}{dx} x^n = nx^{n-1}

The fundamental theorem of calculus states:

\int_a^b f(x) dx = F(b) - F(a)

\int_{a}^b f(x) d x = F(b) - F(a)

title: Trigonometric Identities
content:
Essential Trigonometry

One of the most important identities is:

\sin^2(\theta) + \cos^2(\theta) = 1

Also, the law of sines:

\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}

\int_{a}^b f(x) d x = F(b) - F(a)

title: Physics: Special Relativity
content:
Mass-Energy Equivalence

Albert Einstein's famous equation relates energy and mass:

E = mc^2

The Lorentz factor is defined as:

\gamma = \frac{1}{\sqrt{1 - \frac{v^2}{c^2}}}

\int_{a}^b f(x) d x = F(b) - F(a)
